summary:
**Meeting Overview**:  
The Ad Hoc Committee on Pensions of the Dallas City Council will convene on April 11, 2024, at 3:00 PM in the City Council Chambers, 6th Floor, City Hall. The meeting will be held both in-person and via video conference, primarily aimed at discussing pension-related matters, particularly the funding soundness of the Dallas Police and Fire Pension System.

**Key Agenda Items**:  
1. Approval of the minutes from the previous meeting held on February 8, 2024.
2. A briefing on the Dallas Police and Fire Pension System's Funding Soundness Restoration Plan.

**Important Details**:  
The meeting will include an update on the restoration plan for the pension system, which is critical for ensuring the financial stability of the pension funds. Additionally, there will be a closed session to seek legal advice regarding ongoing litigation involving the Dallas Police Retired Officers Association and the Dallas Police & Fire Pension System.

**Action Items**:  
The committee is seeking approval for the minutes from the February meeting and will discuss the briefing on the pension system's funding plan. Decisions regarding the legal matters discussed in the closed session may also be made, depending on the outcomes of the attorney's advice. 

This meeting is essential for addressing the financial health of the pension system and ensuring compliance with legal obligations.
